authors: Anna Pursglove For The Daily Mail
description: Ballet-shoe pink is very fashionable this season. It's a hard colour to wear without looking like Barbie. Anna Pursglove gives FEMAIL tips on how to pull it off and look great doing it.
title: FEMAIL finds out how to wear pink without looking like Barbie or blancmange
title_page: FEMAIL finds out how to wear pink without looking like Barbie or blancmange | Daily Mail Online
text:
You’d be hard pushed to walk down the High Street this winter without coming across pink.
Not magenta, neon or salmon - we’re talking ballet-shoe pink. The kind of uncompromisingly girly shade you probably haven’t experimented with since you were six.
Fashion designers have fallen in love with pink over the past year, with Prada, Chanel, Dolce & Gabbana and Alexander McQueen sending it down the catwalks. It was inevitable, then, that it would filter through on to the High Street.
But can an adult wear the shade without looking ridiculous? A young girl in pink is often described as cute, but a grown woman? She’s more likely to hear the words ‘Barbie’ or ‘blancmange’.
However, there is good news: you CAN work pink into your wardrobe - provided you stick to a few rules. First, don’t do one single shade top-to-toe. Next, avoid anything unstructured or you’ll be in blancmange territory. Finally, keep it fuss-free - this isn’t the time for sequins.
After that, you’re in the pink.
